description:
lisp-addict allows you to evaluate lisp/scheme-like code on your WebOS device.  We created a WebOS front-end for the same lisp as can be found at http://norstrulde.org/ilge10/

The application contains a tutorial to get you started in programming with this little lisp.

Also:  There's a remote execution mechanism, which allows you to send lisp-code from emacs to your phone, where it will be evaluated.  There's no mojo-specific functionality exported in this lisp yet, so it's fairly safe to run.  By standard it tries to connect to an inexistant address.  This support is contained in the lisp-substance repository at http://github.com/ebb/lisp-substance
